website_summaries.verdict: It has a high air requirement, but in the end this is a smooth running, professional-grade sander.
pros: Fits your hand perfectly for comfort
cons: You'll probably need a larger-capacity compressor, as this sander goes through a lot of air

customer_reviews.title: Great tool but needs a LOT of air
customer_reviews.text: Great product, but be careful, requires a big compressor with a high continuous air flow to run it. My current compressor (about a 400 dollar 110v dual stage compressor) does not produce great enough quantity of air to run this tool. Still, it is a good tool............. I will have to think about a bigger compressor.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph_

customer_reviews.title: Saves me hours of sanding time
customer_reviews.text: Well built, but deducted 2 stars as this is my second one. The first one was used to sand an old front porch over several weekends. Not an average job as the floor boards were in tough shape. Also had to sand a good amount of paint and wood filler. For some reason the sander ceased up after the project. Could have been the condensation build up that was not cleared out, but no real way around it unless you take the whole unit apart. Happy enough with this sander though to purchase another one for other projects. Cuts through wood filler with no issues and leaves professional like results.
customer_reviews.author: Joe's Prime

customer_reviews.title: not for everyday use
customer_reviews.text: This will be a fine tool for home use or the hobbest, not for a body shop. Four dead or broken last year (purchased within the last 16 months). I'm sorry sir, but not built anywhere as good as American made National Detroit 900 @ $450.00 each. However, most of you may not need the bodyman's workhorse.
customer_reviews.author: BOISE M.

customer_reviews.title: Lasted 38 years
customer_reviews.text: I guess Ingersoll Rand has a 38 year life cycle. I bought my first one of these in 1981 along with my first Ingersoll Rand long board and they both went out within about a month or two of each other. While I was only a processional body man for around 8 years I have used both tools extensively for side jobs and personal restoration projects since then. I would say they have paid for themselves many times over.
customer_reviews.author: Forever Better

customer_reviews.title: Very quick and very dusty
customer_reviews.text: This works much quicker than my Festool random orbit sander. There is no way to attach a vacuum, so I use a fan to blow the dust away from the work (and me). If you put the compressor in a separate room, it makes for very quick and very quiet sanding.
customer_reviews.author: rarelyreview

customer_reviews.title: Broke after 1 month of use
customer_reviews.text: I have a new log home that I am using this sander on and the internal counterweight snapped off and will not work. I was able to fix it but the sander as soon as it touches the wood ceases to function. what a waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: J. DelPrete

customer_reviews.title: Better price then 20 years ago 💯
customer_reviews.text: This is s must in the work I do! My 20 year old is still good, But for the price I could not go wrong on buying a new one at a cheaper price then what I paid 20 years ago !
customer_reviews.author: outlaw

customer_reviews.title: Not powerful enough
customer_reviews.text: Had it connected to a 60 gal compressor. Just didn't have the power. I had it up to 110, lbs of air. I sent it back.. GO WITH ELEC..
customer_reviews.author: GZEUSJ

customer_reviews.title: This sander is smooth powerful and a joy to use on large areas
customer_reviews.text: This sander is smooth powerful and a joy to use on large areas. I was stripping paint from a large boat bottom and used it with 80 grit and a hookit pad all from Amazon. Works fantastic !!!
customer_reviews.author: Doug in Madison

customer_reviews.title: Great for making panels flat
customer_reviews.text: This tools are workhorse no doubt. A very nice addition to my sanders.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Bartz

customer_reviews.title: its smooth pretty quiet. Most or all an excellent price for ...
customer_reviews.text: This is an exellent 8 inch da. I am a collision technician and use it almost daily.its smooth pretty quiet. Most or all an excellent price for this type of tool. Thumbs up!
customer_reviews.author: jim walsh

customer_reviews.title: Very Good Sander for stripping paint, exellent !
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this type of sander for at least 30 years + and havent had any problems, with the brand I was using, this is my first I-R sander like this, and so far its as good as the other brand, and alot less expensive, which in my books makes it better, no problems so fsr if any should arise I will for sure get back to the ratings, I would not at this time hesitate to buy another one, I have told all my frinds about AMAZON, and the prices. Thanks for being there when we need some help in America. J. W. Jones
customer_reviews.author: James W. Jones

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Bodyshop machine.
customer_reviews.text: Makes long panels,and Hoods....FLAT. Excellent machine. You need an 80 gallon or larger compressor to run this for long periods of time. This machine is a money maker.
customer_reviews.author: ghettorides

customer_reviews.title: Mud hog, every body man needs one
customer_reviews.text: Love it, I use it for shaping body filler fast. Works great on flat panels such as hoods and roofs then I go over it with a long block.
customer_reviews.author: V. Gamble

customer_reviews.title: they are very well made and this new one i just got is my new best
customer_reviews.text: i have been using this sander IR sander for body work over 35 years ,they are very well made and this new one i just got is my new best friend
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Hogger Ingersol rand
customer_reviews.text: This is a must have tool for the body man. Used like an orbital (GEARED) air file. Removes excessive body filler. Saves lots of time. Also bought paper for this tool on Amazon. Great deal.
customer_reviews.author: AL

customer_reviews.title: Great sander
customer_reviews.text: Great sander. Definitely can take a beating. Works great !
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Big compressor needed
customer_reviews.text: Good product IF you have a big enough compressor to use it. I have a 20 gal 4 scfm @90 psi and it couldn't keep up.
customer_reviews.author: Chase

customer_reviews.title: feels like quality
customer_reviews.text: great tool for the money/ its identicle to the blue point one I bought from Snap On
customer_reviews.author: Ben Murphy

customer_reviews.title: Great Value Hard to beat asset for and DIY or Shop
customer_reviews.text: Awesome Sander and what a deal ! This 8” gear drives are well over 400dollars elsewhere
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: but it's still excellent quality for the price
customer_reviews.text: it's no National Detroit, but it's still excellent quality for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Jordan

customer_reviews.title: bought this for my husband he loves it!!!
customer_reviews.text: The term mud hog fits this orbital extremely well. my husband didn't think it would great... but the day he used it he was extremely pleased.
customer_reviews.author: ericandkate

customer_reviews.title: A good value.
customer_reviews.text: Please realize that this is NOT a National Detroit hog. Read the specifications and you will see that the RPM and air requirements are not the same at all. That being said, I think this is a good little machine. I had an ND for over 20 years and only needed to replace it when someone borrowed it and did not return it. My criticism of this would be the high air requirement (even with a big 5 HP and 60G industrial). It won't really spin much under 90 psi. It will do a nice job however and I do like it. Great deal for the cost.
customer_reviews.author: Tex

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Love this da! My old one died after 10 years or so and this was a perfect replacement!
customer_reviews.author: cj

customer_reviews.title: You won't be sorry .
customer_reviews.text: I used National Det at work for years . I had to get an 8 inch da for my house. I bought this one . Beautiful working tool !! Can't ask anything more from a DA . Carl . N.Y.
customer_reviews.author: kickstart54

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: not as good quality as say 15 yrs ago, but then what is
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: just what I was looking for and a very good price.
customer_reviews.author: Freddie W.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: This is a great tool. Plenty of power and I am very satisfied with it.
customer_reviews.author: Mary Smith

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny in my mind.
customer_reviews.text: Love these things. My go to tool in my shop almost all the time. Can knock off filler quick and evenly. Get used to em, and you don't have a whole lot of blocking to do. Gear drive has some umph. Last forever too if you take care of them. Only replaced my last because I dropped it from top of a semi and bent it too bad.
customer_reviews.author: tORN TV

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful tool
customer_reviews.text: This is precisely the tool that I needed for a major fiberglass refinishing project-- it is easy to use and works excellently
customer_reviews.author: KK

customer_reviews.title: Workhorse
customer_reviews.text: This thing paired up with some 36G discs will strip anything quickly and flush sand like a champ.
customer_reviews.author: Johnny Vegas

customer_reviews.title: Hope it last as long as my previous Ingersoll mud hog
customer_reviews.text: Had a Ingersoll mud hog for years until the handle broke in a fall. Could not find parts to fix it and could not find one anywhere around where I live (rural East Texas). Largest parts store could not even find one in their Ingersoll catalog. Went to Amazon and found several sources and bought mine for a great price, much lower than I expected. I just hope it last as many years as my last one.
customer_reviews.author: Jack

customer_reviews.title: Heavy Duty
customer_reviews.text: This sander is terrific and a great value. I find Ingersol Rand products to be great in general and this 8" sander is no exception.
customer_reviews.author: John K. Mauney Jr

customer_reviews.title: good quality and works better than I expected
customer_reviews.text: been wanting one for years, good quality and works better than I expected, del. time was great
customer_reviews.author: randy bowser

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: Not bad for the money. Doesn't compare to National Detroit if you are a bogyman for a living.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Corgiat

product_meta.title: Ingersoll Rand 328B Heavy Duty Air Geared Orbital Sander - 8-Inch Pad
product_meta.description:
AMAZON.COM


See larger image. The smooth strength and power of the 328B Air Geared Orbital Sander enables you to remove heavy material and body filler on large, flat surfaces, leaving a clean, swirl-free finish. Every detail is shaped to fit your hand perfectly and the lever throttle takes pressure off of your palm. You get the power and precision you need so you can do your best, most sophisticated work. 

WHAT'S IN THE BOX
328B Air Geared Orbital Sander, 8-inch pad, operating instructions

ABOUT INGERSOLL RAND
Ingersoll Rand designs, builds, and delivers an unrivaled assortment of hard-working products and solutions. Ingersoll Rand is a multi-billion dollar global company that has built a reputation for keeping its customers up and running for over a century. From our complete compressed air systems, to our tools, pumps, material handling systems and comprehensive services, Ingersoll Rand offers the depth of knowledge, expertise, and experience to provide the best solution to meet your needs.

SPECIFICATIONS
Power Free Speed RPM Pad Diameter Orbit Diameter Average Air Consumption Air Consumption @ Load 0.25 hp (0.19 kW) 825 8 inches 5/32-inch 4 cfm (113 L/minute) 16 cfm (453 L/minute) Sound Pressure / Power Vibration Air Inlet NPTF In Minimum Hose Size Product Weight 90.5/93.7 dBA 4.6 m/s2 1/4-inch 3/8-inch (10mm) 4.7 pounds 328B HEAVY DUTY AIR GEARED ORBITAL SANDER
AT A GLANCE
 * Dual-action pad motion (5/32-inch orbit)
 * Long-life, low-vibration performance
 * Balanced ball bearing construction
 * 1-year limited warranty



FROM THE MANUFACTURER
All of the latest advances have been designed into Ingersoll Rand's random orbital and orbital series sanders. Every detail is shaped to fit your hand perfectly and the lever throttle takes pressure off of your palm. You get the power and precision you need so you can do your best, most sophisticated work. The smooth strength and power of this air geared orbital sander lets you remove heavy material and body filler on large, flat surfaces leaving a clean, swirl-free finish.

specifications.Warranty Description: 1 year from date of purchase with sales receipt or invoice
